item.title: Building an Intuition: Why do Voronoi Patterns Emerge in so many different places?
chaos
item.description: Chaos is a high degree of sensitivity to initial conditions. To read more see the backlinks or its definition and description in the article on [[computational-irreducibility|computational irreducibility]]

item.title: Complex System
item.description: A complex system has behavior that is [[emergence|emergent]] from its constituent parts

item.title: Computational Irriducibility
item.description: Coming soon, for now I defer to wikipedia

item.title: Doing vs. Being -- Understanding the Thesis
item.description: What does Doing vs. Being Claim? The purpose of this article is to understand what Doing vs. Being is claiming. Many of the details of this argument will have their own articles, where their nuances will be thoroughly explored.

item.title: doing vs. being articles to reference
Edmund Husserl: What are We Able to Study Rigorously?
item.description: There is a powerful irony in our project. It is an attempt to formally study that which has historically eluded formal study.

item.title: Emergence
item.description: Parts become whole. Emergence is when a population of agents have behaviour not present in their constituent parts.

item.title: Functionalism
item.description: Functionalism is the notion that the hardware that a mental state runs on is not important, only the role it plays in the larger cognitive system is of consequence.

item.title: Instrumentality and the Extended Mind
item.description: This is the outline for a short presentation I gave on September 30, 2022 for PHY340: Issues in Philosophy of Mind at the University of Toronto, taught by Dr.

item.title: levin-reading-notes
item.description: The Biophysics of Regenerative Repair Suggests New Perspectives on Biological Causation (M. Levin, 2020) Anatomical “macrostates” can be implemented by a wide range of molecular and cellular arrangements and even time-series trajectories that all implement the same large-scale outcomes.

item.title: Music
item.description: This page contains lists of records that I’ve listened to, and wanted to track my thoughts of, as well as a second list that holds records that I intend to listen to.

item.title: My Compass
item.description: Sometimes I wonder what ancient humans thought as they looked at the motions of the stars–as they told their myths of gods and heroes immortalized in constellations.

item.title: On Humility
item.description: Why Did I Make This Site? In the spring of 2020, I began to take the question ‘how does mind emerge from matter’ quite seriously.

item.title: On the Emergence of Ontologies
item.description: How does sensory information become abstract thought? What is the physical phenomena that brings about abstract thought? This appears like an [[jargon/ontology|ontological]] question but it is rather the question of the emergence of ontology itself.

item.title: Ontology
item.description: Ontology is the branch of metaphysics that is concerned with objects and the nature of being. To read more see the backlinks for articles that relate to ontological questions.

item.title: PHL340 topical discussion: The Extended Mind and Cyberspace
item.description: Blade Runner’s Voight-Kampff test and the Turing Test Let’s recall that the Turing Test is an imitation game–for a computer to convince a human judge to pick a human to be a computer rather than the computer itself.

item.title: Self-Organization
item.description: This one topic is very big and very complicated. I’m very excited to get to it.

item.title: The Eidos: Forms and Essences
item.description: Coming soon, for now I defer to wikipedia
